intro: Hieracium stenomerum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, while the stems are upright and usually unbranched. Hieracium stenomerum is often found in open habitats and can spread through its rhizomes or by seed dispersal.
